lead_paragraph: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds.

byline.contributor: Laura Fauss, Katarina Johannsen and Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin.

snippet: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds.

headline.main: As Germany Welcomes Migrants, Sexual Attacks in Cologne Point to a New Reality
headline.print_headline: Cologne Attacks Highlight Clash Among Cultures

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

abstract: Sexual assaults and robberies by 1,500 men, many of them immigrants, against women in Cologne, Germany, on New Year's Eve points up police miscalculation in dealing with up to million asylum seekers, most from war-riven Muslim countries with different cultures; Germany faces challenge of integrating vast new population amid decreasing tolerance.
